page.title: 07Religion-Dale + St.Ishmaels
page.content: There are two churches in our area, both belonging to the Anglican denomination.One is St.James' Church, Dale and the other is St.Ishmael's Church which gives its name to the nearby village.St.James' Church is estimated to be about 800 years old though it was renovated early this century.It is a small,simple church with a nave,chancel and tower housing one bell.It is built of stone and rendered with rough-cast cement.It has wooden pews to seat about 110.The vicar,Rev.P.Davies, also takes charge of the two neighbouring parishes.St. Ishmael's church was first founded 1300 years ago,possibly part of an ancient monastery.It too has been renovated and is built of stone. It has pews to seat about 140 in the nave and two transepts.The vicar here is Rev.W.Lewis.
